section.header: The following policy(ies)/contract(s) may be changed or replaced as a result of this transaction.

question.text: Insurer As It Appears On The Policy/Contract

group.header: CAUTION: YOU ARE URGERD NOT TO TAKE ACTION TO TERMINATE, ASSIGN OR ALTER YOUR EXISTING LIFE INSURANCE COVERAGE OR ANNUITY CONTRACT UNTIL AFTER YOU HAVE BEEN ISSUED THE NEW POLICY/CONTRCAT, EXAMINED IT AND FOUND IT TO BE ACCEPTABLE TO YOU.

paragragh.text: Permanent life insurance or an Annuity, and an attempt is made to have the holder change or replace the existing insurance.
Replacement of: term life insurance, credit life insurance, group insurance, and policies issued in connection with pension, profit sharing, or other benefit plan.
1. Present Comparative Form (not later than when taking application), complete it and leave a signed copy with applicant.
2. Submit copy of Comparative Form (completed and signed) with application.
3. Submit copy of Comparative Form (completed and signed) to existing insurer.

Churning is an unfair method of competition or deceptive act or practice, wherein the licensee replaces an existing policy of life insurance or annuity contract and that replacement is not in accordance with section 23-66-307 or that replacement is without objective demonstration by the licensee of the purpose of replacing the policy for the benefit and betterment of the insured.
Retain copy of Comparative Form for 3 years.
No duties under this statute and related bulletins.
Not defined - no requirements under this statute and related bulletins.
